/>
II.iii.2.F.1.a
.
Who May Withdraw an Initial Claim and What Types of Claims May Be Withdrawn
A claimant or a claimant’s authorized representative may withdraw any type of initial claim that is before the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), to include a claim for
disability compensation
Veterans Pension
additional benefits for dependents
survivors benefits, or
an apportionment of benefits.
Important
:  The procedures reflected in this section apply to initial claims only.
References
:  For more information on the withdrawal of
claims, see
Hanson v. Brown
, 9 Vet.App. 29 (1996), and
Delisio v. Shinseki
, 25 Vet.App. 45 (2011)
decision reviews (including higher-level reviews (HLRs) and supplemental claims), see
38 CFR 3.2500(d)
, and
M21-5, Chapter 4, Topic 4
appeals under the jurisdiction of the Board of Veterans' Appeals (BVA), see
38 CFR 20.205
, and
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section A.3.e
, and
legacy appeals, see
38 CFR 19.55
, and
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section A.3
.
title: M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section F - Withdrawal of Initial Claims
citation: Part II, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section F
